text: you
how
after years of traveling solo Footloose
and fancy-free I've entered a new
chapter in my life parenthood I'm Matt
gross the frugal traveler for the new
york times and when i flew to italy with
my wife jean at six week old daughter
Sasha we quickly learned that traveling
with an infant is a bit different from
traveling on our own it all starts at
home baby tylenol babies require a lot
of gear a whole lot of gear a ridiculous
amount of gear the packing alone can be
exhausting and the suitcase can weigh
more than the baby herself even though
it was snowing we didn't take a cab we
went to the airport the cheapest way
possible by train eleven dollars total
on the LIRR and ten dollars more for the
airtrain sasha road free and we avoided
rush hour traffic traveling with an
infant overseas you get a real throwback
more session
Sasha's first encounter with security
went smoothly even though we don't have
the video to prove it at the gate we met
the leopards like us they were on their
way to Venice we've actually traveled
internationally quite often with his
tour and the key day yeah I guess the
key is supporting lots of activities for
them to do fans upon books upon anything
that you can pack your diaper bag full
everything will last about 10 minutes
and I want to do something new we booked
a Monday evening flight hoping it would
be empty and it was no problem getting
bulkhead seats where the flight
attendants hooked up a bassinet to keep
her entertained all we needed was a
light switch
six hours later and after a surprisingly
peaceful flight we were in Venice where
we caught the 5 euro bus into the city
Sasha spent a week seeing the sights and
taking boats through the canals having a
baby this small didn't really change how
we enjoyed Venice okay eating in
restaurants was occasionally a challenge
and we spent a lot more time back at our
hotel and it's a good thing that Venice
especially in winter is not a late-night
kind of place but overall we were amazed
at how easy it was to be the frugal
family
too soon it was back to the airport for
our flight home and as luck would have
it sasha was just as unhappy about the
three-hour flight delay as we were
thankfully the flight attendants know
how to deal with unhappy children
there's nothing there always perfect
so she cries and cries and cries
and eventually no reason
get this
anxiety frustration fear well I faced
them all and I think we did all right
but from what I hear it gets more
complicated as they get older but for
now we're enjoying traveling with our
little crew Galina and saving money
while we're at
